content.rendered:
Salesforce Apps

Running your org isn’t easy, but with the right tools in your toolkit (or utility belt), you can streamline your process and shine like the #AwesomeAdmin you are.  Here you will find apps, extensions, add-ins, generators, and other tools to  help you do just that, increase productivity, automate workflow, and simplify tasks associated with org management.
This page lists the Salesforce Apps that I have reviewed and written about that are recommended for your Toolkit. Some are to streamline the administration of your org focused on the backend of Salesforce, others are for use by end users, managed by the administrator, tofill in for functionality that is needed across industries.Hope they help you out!

Apps

  • Object Metadata Snapshot

    The Object Metadata Snapshot is a great, free way to start documenting your org. Learn what it does, how to use it, the pros & cons in this post.

    Read More

  • Conga Composer

    Conga Composer is not only an amazing app for your Salesforce org, but it is an amazing company with customer service that will blow your mind.

    Read More

  • Octopus by Astrea

    Octopus is a no-brainer when it comes to documenting your org. Workflow rules, validation rules, picklist values, this guy pulls it all for you, with one click, and free.

    Read More

  • Etherios EasyDescribe

    Etherios EasyDescribe is an easy to use tool with a huge impact. With just a few clicks you can view and export your Salesforce metadata for easy org documentation. A must for all Salesforce administrators for documenting your org.

    Read More

jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: I love, love, love it! I love the Salesforce Inspector, I use it multiple times a day every single day, you can find the field requirements, field type, API names, export data, import data, and more!
